basic.description: This course covers graphs and digraphs, trees and connectivity, Euler and Hamilton tours, colorings, matchings, planarity and Ramseys theorem, applications. A proof-oriented course that assumes no previous exposure to graph theory but assumes a certain level of mathematical maturity.
basic.subject: MAD
basic.title: Graph Theory

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: Graduate standing (for majors) or department approval (for non-majors).
